intro: Pimpinella orientalis, commonly known as the oriental cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a narrow, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature, a common feature among members of its family. Pimpinella orientalis is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
